content: oh oh hey DM scotty here welcome to another episode of short tip i had a
viewer asked me about making stalagmites and i have a great way to do it it's
super cheap easy to do and i'm going to show you right now but one thing i
wanted to mention was i would love to see any terrain that you guys out there
are making so send to my email address here and just put DMS craft pics in the
tag line and i'll check it out and see what you got and send those pics i'd
love to see them let's get on to making those select lights
hey welcome to the DMS craft today I've got a really super easy and fun way to
make stalagmites those things that grow up from the bottom of caves over time so
right now I've just got a toilet roll tube so I'm going to do is start to form
this so I'll just take a couple fingers in and just twist it up take my fingers
out just do some more twisting till I get kind of an interesting shape
okay so there I've got pretty interesting shape there so now what I'm
going to do is I'm going to take some card stock that I have and that so here
I've got my card stock now I'll take the stalagmite put it on there and I'm just
going to trace around so some extra room okay so there I've got that so now I've
got a base for the stalagmite so I'm not going to cut it out
there I've got my base and here's my select might so I will put on there now
I'm going to use my trusty glue gun my friend and I'm going to put some glue
around the base of the toilet tube so there we go just a super easy way to
make that now I'm going to do is I'm going to add some texture to it with the
glue gun you could skip the step you could just paint this as is just base
paint in black and then paint it how it is but I want to add a little more
texture to it so I'm going to take my glue gun and just start I want to cover
up those lines to where that where the tube connects so this will do to fold it
will not only make it sturdier and give it some interest it'll cover up those
lines on the tube now I'm putting some on the base to to
give it some texture and I have the slag might very well covered with the hot
glue and now we'll paint that up with the flat black and I'll see what it
looks like so here we have I the stalagmite all
painted base painted black I can see how interesting that looks next looks
nothing like a toilet roll anymore you could also do things with this like
you could make this like a stump in a forest where the trees are all decimated
that kind of thing too so don't be limited by thinking of it like
stalagmite you could do all kinds of stuff with this so what I'll do now is
I've got a paste painted black so I'm just going to dry brush it with a dark
grey and that's all start so I'll just put brush put paint on the brush and I'm
not putting any water on this so I'll just go over the surface and I'll let
the natural indentations in the surface create the shading
see how that pops right out there and I've only done one of these but when you
do this you want to do more than one you want to do it you know half a dozen or
so and then you can always just reuse these and so these are on a base you
could use them in D caves you can also cut them at different
heights you would have to make them all the same height if you want to make them
shorter just cut the bait when you crinkle the the tube just cut the base
off of it so there we go I've got that all painted gray and now
what I'll do is I'll let that dry and then we'll do a highlight on it
now my gray is dry so I'm going to hit it with a lighter gray
I remember when you're doing the highlights you don't want to kill it I'm
going to get some just like I did with the dark gray some just put a dry brush
on there so I'm not putting water now I'm going to gently go over this much
less gently than I went over with the gray so just give it some highlights you
don't want to kill it pick out those ridges yeah one one problem with the
painting on some people get a little heavy-handed so just be gentle you can
always add more much harder to take it away just be a little gentle don't get
on there alright now I'm going to do the base too
so look at that look how good that looks and you can have as many as you want
just save those toilet paper rolls and one last thing you can also add some
like moss or something in the cave so I'm going to use a green and just kind
of a medium green and then just I'm not going to put that much I'm just going to
get some of the brush and I'm just getting a few spots just drag it up so
it gives a little bit of interest and you can do that or not so there we go
easy slag might very cheap easy to make and I will see you next time
on short tip you
